title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 Massachusetts ballot proposals advance, including rent control and tax changes, while three failed to meet legal requirements.
Proponents must gather 74,574 signatures by December 3; additional steps needed if Legislature does not pass proposals.
Rent control proposal limits increases to 5% or CPI; specific exemptions apply, influencing potential voter opinions.

title: Livestream: RFK Jr. questioned at Senate committee hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: RFK Jr. faced Senate Finance Committee over 'Make America Healthy Again' plans, criticizing CDC's pandemic actions.
Senators challenged Kennedy's vaccine policies; Sen. Ron Wyden accused him of spreading misinformation and disrupting CDC leadership.
Discover why top medical groups, including the American Medical Association, demand Kennedy's resignation amid vaccine policy controversy.

title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: UMass Lowell went into a three-hour lockdown due to a juvenile carrying an airsoft replica weapon.
The incident prompted a massive response from local police, FBI, and other law enforcement agencies.
Authorities are assessing potential criminal charges for the juvenile involved in the security scare.

title: A new BBJ report rejiggers the list of state’s wealthiest zip codes. Here’s who’s on top now.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Back Bay, 02116, tops Massachusetts' wealthiest zip codes with a $1.3M median home value, surpassing Dover.
South End ranks second despite a 24% poverty rate, highlighting a significant wealth gap in the area.
Cape Cod's first entry, North Chatham, ranks 46th, with a notable shift in zip code rankings this year.

title: Wu admin. to send nearly 100 recent police academy grads to Mass. and Cass
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston to deploy nearly 100 new police academy graduates to Mass. and Cass for increased law enforcement presence.
Mayor Wu's administration addresses public safety concerns with expanded police efforts and community recovery initiatives.
Discover how these changes aim to reduce outdoor substance use and increase arrests in targeted Boston neighborhoods.

title: Could cocoa help delay high blood pressure? Here’s what Brigham and Women’s researchers found.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Brigham and Women's researchers suggest cocoa extract could help older adults maintain normal blood pressure long term.
The COSMOS study found a 24% reduction in hypertension incidence for participants with baseline systolic pressure under 120 mmHg.
Despite potential benefits, cocoa extract differs from store-bought chocolate; nutritional components like flavanols are key.

title: Here’s a list of 2025 Patriots predictions from beat writers and national analysts
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots predictions for 2025 season range from 7-10 to 9-8 by beat writers.
NFL.com and ESPN analytics give Patriots around 8 wins, with a 30.5% playoff chance.
Cynthia Frelund's simulations estimate fractional win totals; Patriots predicted to win 8.8 games.

title: Couple climbs through sunroof to help screaming toddler left in car at South Shore shopping plaza
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A Brockton mother faces charges for leaving her toddler in a hot car at Hingham's Derby Street Shops.
A couple heard the child's cries and climbed through the sunroof to rescue the 22-month-old.
Discover how long the child was left unattended before police arrived at the scene.

title: Readers: How do you feel about Bill Belichick’s college football debut?
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Bill Belichick made his college football debut as UNC head coach against TCU, losing 48-14.
Patriots fans were surprised by Belichick's defensive struggles, allowing the most points in his career.
Readers are invited to share their thoughts on Belichick's new role and performance with the Tar Heels.

title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Life Alive Organic Cafe opens new location in Burlington, offering smoothies and grain bowls.
Blank Street Coffee to replace Twin Donuts in Allston, retaining iconic neon sign.
Iru in Brookline reopens Oct. 12, featuring new dishes inspired by Asian travels.
